datafield.subfield: insert (Pete Kuykendall; 18 years old [in 1956]; b. Arlington, Va.)
label (Kuykendall) insert (Peter Kuykendall, 5-string banjo; also plays other bluegrass instruments; recording technician at Library of Congress; b. 1938, Arlington, Va.)

p. 159 (In 1958 the Gentlemen hires a new banjo player, Peter V. Kuykendall (he used the stage name of Pete Roberts), the deejay and record collector who had helped Mike Seeger plan his first Flokways album on Skruggs-style banjo; like Seeger, he had performed on that recording and also on Mountain Music Bluegrass Style)
International Bluegrass Music Museum website, Nov. 17, 2011

(Peter V Kuykendall; b. Jan. 15, 1938, Washington, D.C.; Primary Instrument: Banjo; composed and arranged songs that are now standards in bluegrass; one of the founders of Bluegrass Unlimited magazine in 1966, and editor since 1970; a partner in Wynwood Music Company; his mother's career as a piano instructor made lessons on that instrument his first musical endeavor)
